# mlcrawler

Welcome to the mlcrawler documentation.

mlcrawler is a thin, configurable Python crawler and scraper that supports both a command-line interface and an importable library API. Use this documentation to learn how to install, configure, and integrate mlcrawler into your projects.

Quick links

- Getting started: Getting Started
- Installation guide: Installation
- API reference: API Reference
- CLI usage: CLI Usage
- Examples: Examples

---

## What is mlcrawler?

mlcrawler helps you crawl websites in a polite and configurable manner. It supports:

- Sitemap discovery and parsing
- Seed URL crawling with optional link following
- Content extraction (main-article extraction using trafilatura or full-page extraction)
- HTML â†’ Markdown conversion
- Disk caching and conditional GET handling
- Pluggable output (Markdown + metadata sidecars by default)

Whether you want to run it from the CLI or call it from Python code, this documentation will guide you through both workflows.
